data.title: Evergreen
data.meta_description: Located in Town Centre Park, Coquitlam, Evergreen Cultural Centre is the Tri-Cities venue for live arts experiences, events, and exhibitions.
data.text:
WELCOME TO EVERGREEN

The Tri-Cities premiere venue & cultural hub for live arts events, experiences, and exhibitions since 1996.

FULL CALENDARVISIT THE ART GALLERY

LIVE PERFORMANCES | GALLERY EXHIBITIONS | ART WORKSHOPS

CHECK OUT WHAT’S GOING ON AT EVERGREEN

mon19aug6:00 pmmon7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Kim Lorene 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Monday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

KIM LORENE Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

KIM LORENE

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Kim Lorene is a singer-songwriter who grew up in Coquitlam surrounded by the lush green landscapes of southern British Columbia. Her music is inspired by the beauty found in nature, as well as in people and animals, and in the thread of life that connects us all. She writes songs that are both soothing and uplifting, inviting us into a world filled with that beauty, along with a bit of whimsy! Her warm, rich vocals are accompanied by acoustic guitar, and more recently by the fun addition of ukulele. Over the years she has performed in the United States and Europe as well as closer to home, sharing her original songs along with a wide selection of classic covers from folk, jazz, and pop genres that people will recognize and enjoy singing along with.

Come and be enchanted!

GoogleCal

tue20aug6:00 pmtue7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: What We Embrace 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Tuesday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

WHAT WE EMBRACE Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

WHAT WE EMBRACE

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTISTS

Duo Lindalouise and Dougie met in a dimly lit bar where Dougie was singing in a tiny Scottish town many years ago. They fell in love, married and moved halfway across the world. One day with shaky hands, Lindalouise took a journal of songs that she’d been secretly writing to Dougie, a writer she deeply admired. It was just over three years ago they decided to embrace a new journey. What We Embrace tell stories, some triumphant, some less so. Their sound is teetering between Indie Folk, Alt Country and New Americana, their voices blending, lifting and weaving to unexpected places. Each song is a journey through heartbreak, love, uncertainty and redemption. They make music for the dreamers, the broken and the yet-to-be-found.

GoogleCal

wed21aug6:00 pmwed7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Warren Nipp 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Wednesday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

WARREN NIPP Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

WARREN NIPP

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Warren Nipp is long time local performer specializing in playing unique instrumental fingerstyle guitar arrangements of songs from a variety of genres and artists! When you hear Warren, you will hear songs ranging from the Beatles to the Weeknd to Tom Petty to Green Day to Usher to Taylor Swift and more, all on just one guitar! He will even play some funky originals to go along with your radio favourites. Warren has been playing and performing for audiences since the 1980’s. He has released three recordings, Mosaic (1999), No Cover Charge (2006), and All Mixed Up (2009). His original music has been featured on Canadian radio and his recordings have garnered high praise in various media outlets. Warren hopes you are able to come out and enjoy some of his guitar music on a beautiful summer evening at Lafarge Lake!

GoogleCal

thu22aug6:00 pmthu7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Sabrielle 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Thursday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

SABRIELLE Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

SABRIELLE

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Sabrielle is a versatile singer and burgeoning songwriter with a diverse musical background and “New York City voice”. Born into a family of musicians, Sabrielle was singing before she could talk and harmonizing before she could walk! Whether it’s pop, gospel, jazz or R&B, Sabrielle’s soulful voice and intuitive storytelling breathes new life into every song she performs. Sabrielle has performed across the lower mainland, Vancouver Island, and the Fraser Valley, from intimate pubs and coffee shops to festival stages and red curtain theatres. She leads a women’s vocal trio, Dia, has curated performances for the Burnaby Heritage Museum and Evergreen Cultural Centre’s Rehearsal Hall Series, and, last December she joined Winter Harp as the lead singer for their 30th anniversary tour.

As a songwriter, Sabrielle is inspired by pop icons like Sara Bareilles, Ingrid Michaelson, Alicia Keys and Lana Del Ray, layered with hints of the gospel, jazz and RnB that she grew up with.

fri23aug7:30 pmfri10:00 pmThe Comedy Department: Pants On Fire! 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Buy Tickets

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!

Time

(Friday) 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

Pants On Fire! The Comedy Department ABOUT THE

Event Details

Pants On Fire!

The Comedy Department

ABOUT THE SHOW

Pants on Fire is an exciting mash up of The Liars Club Game Show andWhose Line Is It Anyway? This non-stop laughs comedy show explores the fascinating world of the lies we tell. Think you can spot a liar? Come find out! Each night, a different member of the audience (or surprise celebrity guest!)is invited onstage to tell some truths but mostly lies and fool everyone in the process. These lies could range from little white lies to larger than life deceptions that may have shaped history! The performers are left to sort fact from fiction, catch the liar and spin all the tall tales into comedy gold. Get your laugh on as we crown our guests Honest Humans OR Master Deceivers!

Pants on Fire is a raucous comedy romp reminding us that sometimes themost captivating stories are born out of the lies we tell. The truth is funny, but the lies are hilarious.

ABOUT THE COMEDY DEPARTMENT

The Comedy Department is Vancouver’s newest destination for comedy! Canadian Comedy Award-winning performers, Denise Jones and David Milchard have established a world-class special event and corporate custom comedy company. Also offering weekly live shows downtown, The Comedy Department is TOPRATED on TripAdvisor. Working with some of the best improvisers in North America, The Comedy Department is guaranteed to bring the laughs to any event! There is a very good chance you’ve seen them on Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, CW, ABC, NBC, CBS, CBC, CRAVE and more. Maybe you’ve seen one of their regular performers on YouTube’s Convos With My 2-Year-Old (125+ million views)! Their performers have toured across North America, Australia and The Caribbean. They’ve also performed at comedy festivals such as: Just For Laughs, BumberShoot, Edmonton’s Improvaganza, and the Chicago, Seattle, Miami, Vancouver and San Francisco Improv festivals.

SINGLE TICKETS ON SALE!

Adults: $39 | Seniors: $35 | Students: $16

GoogleCal

fri23aug6:00 pmfri7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Rebecca Erin Curtis 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Friday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

REBECCA ERIN CURTIS Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

REBECCA ERIN CURTIS

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Rebecca Erin Curtis is a singer/songwriter/storyteller currently residing in the Greater Vancouver area. Shy in public, her mother put her in a local music theatre group. There was no going back. In 2018, she graduated from MacEwan Univeristy’s Theatre Arts program. Looking for more training, she attended Capilano Univeristy’s Musical Theatre program and graduated in 2022. Though she love musical theatre, her passion for music has always driven her through life. On top of singing and tap-dancing, she plays six instruments: the piano, guitar, ukulele, clarinet, trumpet and violin. Being raised on musicals and country music, she appreciates the storytelling aspect of songwriting.

Inspired by artists such as Carole King, Sara Bareilles, The Band Perry, and Taylor Swift, she started writing songs at 14 years old. In recent years, she has been considering writing music for the stage. While attending Capilano University, she was lucky enough to compose the songs for their production of The Penelopiad. Though she is dabbling in writing for musicals, she strives for her songs to be honest, thought provoking but hopeful . She hopes to put out an EP in a few years and share her music with more people.

sat24aug7:30 pmsat10:00 pmThe Comic Strippers: Good Times and Tan Lines 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

Good Times and Tan LinesThe Comic Strippers

Event Details

Good Times and Tan Lines

The Comic Strippers

ABOUT THE COMIC STRIPPERS

A SHOW FOR ALL GENDERS

WARNING! No extreme nudity, just extreme hilarity.

A fictitious male stripper troupe (played by a cast of some of Canada’s best improvisational comedians) perform sexylarious improv comedy shows. They try to be sexy… it just comes out funny. Constantly grooving and gyrating in between scenes they banter with the crowd and perform their hilarious twist on improv sketches. They sing, they “dance”, and they are ready to make you laugh. Semi undressed and completely unscripted, The Comic Strippers take off their shirts and take on your suggestions to create a whole new genre of comedy.

Please note, this event is 19+.

SINGLE TICKETS ON SALE!

Adults: $39 | Seniors: $35 | Students: $16

Evergreen Cultural Centre Rehearsal Hall

1205 Pinetree Way

Event Details

Improv Workshop with Pearce Visser Sunday, August 25 | 1:30pm

Event Details

Improv Workshop with Pearce Visser

Sunday, August 25 | 1:30pm

ABOUT THE WORKSHOP

In this 2 hour workshop, you will dive into the core skills of improv, and the joy and discovery that improv offers!

Students will be coached in the areas of spontaneity, creativity, teamwork, trust, acceptance of the ideas of others, listening, story-telling, character creation and environment work, all while laughing and having fun! This class is suitable for folks who are both brand new to improv and those returning to it with some experience under their belts. Come and dip your toes in, or jump off the deep end!

ABOUT PEARCE VISSER

Pearce Visser is an actor / entertainer / improvisor with 30 years in the comedy business. As current member of the Canadian Comedy Award winning improv comedy troupe The Comic Strippers, he has been overjoyed to travel all across Canada for over 10 years making people laugh. Pearce is an improv veteran and has taught improv extensively from middle schools to team building events with corporate clients.

REGISTRATION IS ON NOW – ONLY $39!

Pair this workshop with a show during our Comedy Weekend and get 15% off!

mon26aug6:00 pmmon7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Francis Baptiste 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Monday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

FRANCIS BAPTISTE Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

FRANCIS BAPTISTE

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Francis Baptiste is an Indigenous songwriter and music journalist from the Osoyoos Indian Band. His debut LP, Snəqsilxʷ (Family), features songs sung in Nsyilxcən [nah-silk-sen], the endangered language of the Syilx [see-ilks] people. Approximately 50 elders can fluently speak Nsyilxcən. For Baptiste, his journey in learning the language and teaching it to his son begins with this album. Family (Snəqsilxʷ) is his effort to preserve and connect with this vital part of his heritage. Baptiste is also a music journalist who writes for Exclaim, Permanent Rain Press, and Vancouver Weekly. Currently, he lives in Vancouver, BC.

GoogleCal

tue27aug6:00 pmtue7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Collage Singers 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Tuesday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

COLLAGE SINGERS Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

COLLAGE SINGERS

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTISTS

Collage began 25 years ago as a small group of women who loved to sing together. Weekly practices were a lot of fun and we were delighted to hear our sound becoming tighter and more polished. Lots of fun and laughter kept the group energized and motivated, and we soon expanded to include a small tenor and bass section. The gentlemen not only greatly enhanced our sound, but they made it possible for us to tackle a wider repertoire. We perform at churches, community fairs, fundraisers, private parties and similar events throughout the BC Lower Mainland.

Our membership has changed over the years, but making beautiful music and having fun doing it, has always been Collage’s hallmark.

GoogleCal

wed28aug6:00 pmwed7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Amirali Mir 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Wednesday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

AMIRALI MIR Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

AMIRALI MIR

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Amirali Mir is a 15-year-old pianist on an extraordinary musical journey driven by a profound passion for the enchanting power of music. From a young age, the piano has captivated his soul with its ability to convey emotions and tell stories without words. Through countless hours of practice and unwavering dedication, Amirali has embarked on a remarkable path of growth and exploration. While rooted in classical traditions, he also embraces contemporary compositions, venturing into genres like jazz and film scores. This diverse musical landscape broadens his artistic horizons, enabling him to craft unique and compelling performances that captivate audiences.

Participating in local and regional piano competitions has provided invaluable opportunities for growth and recognition. These experiences have sharpened Mir’s technical proficiency and honed his ability to convey emotions through music. With each performance, he strives to touch hearts and bridge cultural divides, sharing the transcendent beauty of music with listeners worldwide. Looking to the future, Amirali aims to expand his repertoire, collaborate with other musicians, and pursue opportunities to perform on larger stages. Additionally, Mir is passionate about inspiring younger generations, igniting their love for music and showcasing its transformative power. Join him as he continues to explore the boundless world of music, creating moments of pure magic and leaving a lasting impact through his piano performances. Together, embark on this incredible journey of artistic expression and musical discovery.

GoogleCal

thu29aug6:00 pmthu7:00 pmOpen Air Performance Series: Jhoely Triana 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Thursday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

JHOELY TRIANA Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

JHOELY TRIANA

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Jhoely Triana, born in Colombia, is a Vancouver based flamenco dancer and choreographer. Jhoely trained at the Goh Ballet Academy, completed a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Contemporary Dance at Simon Fraser University, and studied at Al Mozaico Flamenco and Rosario Flamenco. She has presented work at the Victoria Flamenco Festival, Vancouver International Flamenco Festival, the Dance Centre, Vines Festival, New Works Dance, BC Culture Days, Evergreen Cultural Centre, Knox Performance Centre and Presentation House’s Ann MacDonald Studio. Jhoely has also travelled to Spain, Poland and the USA for professional development intensives. Jhoely’s work emphasizes connection to the audience through authenticity of emotion and vulnerability.

Time

(Friday) 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Event Details

RACHEL ANGCO Open Air Performance Series

Event Details

RACHEL ANGCO

Open Air Performance Series

From July 8th – August 30th, 2024 join us for a free, 1-hour performance every Monday to Friday at 6PM as part of our Open Air Performance Series. By expanding our arts experiences into Town Centre Park, we hope these events will excite our patrons and introduce us to new faces and Lake Lafarge lovers alike. Grab your picnic basket and enjoy a free professional concert in the park!

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Rachel Angco is a proud Filipina-Canadian actor and singer, based in Vancouver. As a graduate of the BFA in Acting and Master of Management dual degree at the University of British Columbia, Rachel’s credits range from songwriting, musical theatre, and devised experimental theatre productions to commercial, film, and voice-over work. Rachel has been performing for the last decade and began her musical journey singing jazz and R&B with live bands across the lower mainland. Now, her passion for the stage has expanded into theatre and film acting, while continuing her love for singing, accompanying herself with her beloved piano and guitar! Rachel believes music is a powerful tool to unite communities and build connections across differences.

sat14sep4:30 pmsat7:00 pmCindy Mochizuki: Tour and Opening Reception 4:30 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Time

(Saturday) 4:30 pm - 7:00 pm(GMT-07:00)

Location

Art Gallery at Evergreen

1205 Pinetree Way

Event Details

Cindy Mochizuki: stories best told at twilightTour and Opening Reception Saturday, September 14 |

Event Details

Cindy Mochizuki: stories best told at twilight

Tour and Opening Reception

Saturday, September 14 | 4:30 – 7pm

Artist tour at 4:30pm, remarks at 6pm

Part of Evergreen Cultural Centre’s Season Launch Party

Join us on Saturday, September 14th for an artist-led tour and the opening reception of Cindy Mochizuki: stories best told at twilight at the Art Gallery at Evergreen. This event is part of the 2024-25 Season Launch at Evergreen Cultural Centre.

A tour with artist Cindy Mochizuki will begin at 4:30 pm, followed by the opening reception for the exhibition from 5–7 pm. Light refreshments will be served. The tour will be approximately 30 minutes; remarks will take place at 6 pm.

This event is wheelchair accessible. Pay parking available on-site, easy access from Lafarge Lake-Douglas Skytrain Station.

About the Exhibition

Some stories are best told at twilight. As the sun sets below the horizon and darkness emerges, the veil lifts between the everyday and the spirit realm. Supernatural creatures inhabit our world: haunting dreams and lullabies, appearing in the pages of legends and recounted through the memories of elders. This magic manifests in the whimsical storytelling of artist Cindy Mochizuki. stories best told at twilight focuses on the artist’s telling of Japanese myths, legends and folklore. Each artwork—which might manifest as a short animation, an elaborate installation or a singular performance—is the result of an abundance of images and objects that came before. This solo exhibition goes behind the curtain, taking a rare look at the artist’s usually hidden creative process and spanning artworks created over more than a decade.

Event Details

Songs for NobodiesPresented by First Impressions Theatreby Joanna Murray-Smith When a great singer lets her voice float out

Event Details

Songs for Nobodies

Presented by First Impressions Theatre

by Joanna Murray-Smith

When a great singer lets her voice float out over the anonymous crowd, or form the grooves of thousands of records, or flow through radios into millions of homes across the world, she makes countless connections with people. The singer has their story, and the listeners have their own. Should those stories touch each other, there can be magic. In Songs for Nobodies, we meet five unknown women who are touched by the great singers percieved to be living the dream: Judy Garland, Patsy Cline, Edith Piaf, Billie Holiday, and Maria Callas.

This one-woman show features a powerhouse performance by Sheila Sharma and a live band who weave the music of five legendary divas through a mosaic of stories told by an everyday woman, who had unexpected and life-changing encounters with these musical icons.

This show is only available with the purchase of a 2024-25 Theatre Series Subscription.

Save 20% with a Theatre Series subscription! Single Tickets on sale July 01, 2024.

BOX OFFICE: 604.927.6555 | Open Monday – Saturday, 12 – 5PM

fri27sep6:30 pmfri8:30 pmTowards Truth and Reconciliation: Comic Workshop with Jordanna George 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm(GMT-07:00)

Buy Tickets

PRE-REGISTRATION ON NOW

Location

Studio A

Event Details

Towards Truth and Reconciliation: Comic WorkshopJordanna George How can you play a

Event Details

Towards Truth and Reconciliation: Comic Workshop

Jordanna George

How can you play a part in reconciliation? Join artist Jordanna George for an illustration workshop and creative activity in honour of the National Day for Truth and Reconciliation. This public program, inspired by Hummingbird Takes Flight by q̓ic̓əy̓ (Katzie) First Nation artist sɬə́məxʷ, Rain Pierre, is a meaningful opportunity to reflect on Truth and Reconciliation and create an artwork in response to the ways we can take action. Hummingbird Takes Flight (2021) is a digital drawing by Rain Pierre which incorporates Coast Salish design and symbolism. The artwork is exhibited on the windows of Evergreen Cultural Centre and is an offering of protection and a reminder to passers-by of the possibilities present all around us.

Family friendly, ages 12+ recommended. Free to attend.

ABOUT JORDANNA GEORGE

Jordanna George (they/them) is an artist of mixed T’Sou-ke and Ukrainian ancestry. Originally from their ancestral land in Sooke, BC, they now live on the unceded territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), Səl̓ílwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) and Kʷikʷəƛ ̓əm (Kwikwetlem) Nations in Coquitlam, BC. Since earning a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Victoria in 2019, they have primarily been making comics and illustrations. Their explorations of identity, belonging and hope are influenced by Indigeneity, queerness and science fiction. The rest of George’s artistic practice involves painting and sculpture, following similar themes in their illustrative work.

ABOUT THE EXHIBITION

Artist sɬə́məxʷ, Rain Pierre works collaboratively to create artwork intended to inspire. Hummingbird Takes Flight (2021) depicts a hummingbird—an animal of great personal and cultural significance—as it visits two hanging fuchsia flowers. For many Coast Salish cultures, the hummingbird is a messenger of joy and bringer of luck. Presented on the windows of Evergreen Cultural Centre, the work is a reminder to passers-by of the possibilities present all around us. Pierre is a q̓ic̓əy̓ (Katzie) First Nation visual artist and the owner and founder of RainAwakens, a seven-person arts team that produces public art and engagement events around the world.

Image: sɬə́məxʷ, Rain Pierre, Hummingbird Takes Flight, 2021, digital drawing. Courtesy of the artist.

Songs for NobodiesPresented by First Impressions Theatreby Joanna Murray-Smith When a great singer lets her voice float out

Event Details

Songs for Nobodies

Presented by First Impressions Theatre

by Joanna Murray-Smith

When a great singer lets her voice float out over the anonymous crowd, or form the grooves of thousands of records, or flow through radios into millions of homes across the world, she makes countless connections with people. The singer has their story, and the listeners have their own. Should those stories touch each other, there can be magic. In Songs for Nobodies, we meet five unknown women who are touched by the great singers percieved to be living the dream: Judy Garland, Patsy Cline, Edith Piaf, Billie Holiday, and Maria Callas.

This one-woman show features a powerhouse performance by Sheila Sharma and a live band who weave the music of five legendary divas through a mosaic of stories told by an everyday woman, who had unexpected and life-changing encounters with these musical icons.

This show is only available with the purchase of a 2024-25 Theatre Series Subscription.

Save 20% with a Theatre Series subscription! Single Tickets on sale July 01, 2024.

BOX OFFICE: 604.927.6555 | Open Monday – Saturday, 12 – 5PM

ANNOUNCING OUR 2024-2025 SEASON

You don’t have to go downtown to see the best professional arts events in BC. Starting this September, enjoy more than 50 live theatre performances, concerts, comedy nights, and family shows as part of our 28th Season of events. Single Tickets are on sale now!

Visiting Lake Lafarge? Check out our free Open Air Concerts!

Box Office: 604.927.6555 | Open Monday – Saturday, 12 – 5pm

SUMMER EVENTS AT EVERGREEN

Summer Nights at Lafarge Lake have never looked better! Join us for a sizzling lineup of arts events, activities, and community celebrations.

Don’t forget to visit our Outdoor Exhibitions!

Explore art at Evergreen and the Lafarge Lake-Douglas SkyTrain Station.

Image: Silas Ng, Music in My Eyes, 2020–, site-specific installation at the Art Gallery at Evergreen, Evergreen Cultural Centre, 2024. Photo: Rachel Topham Photography.

THE ART GALLERY AT EVERGREEN

IS CLOSED FOR RENOVATIONS

July 22 – September 06, 2024

This summer, the Art Gallery at Evergreen (AGE) will be closed while we upgrade our gallery’s HVAC system. This new infastructure will allow us to maintain better conditions for the artwork on display. While our main gallery space is closed, please enjoy our current public art exhibitions, located on Evergreen’s lake-side lobby windows and at the Lafarge Lake-Douglas Skytrain Station.

evergreenarts

We are the Tri-Cities premiere live event venue, art gallery, community hub + arts education space.

Connect with our Gallery: @artgalleryevergreen

artgalleryevergreen

We are a public art gallery at @evergreenarts in Coquitlam, BC. Admission is always free.
